Posts.Content: Ok it's been 7 months since surgery and my PSA is still 0 so am I considered to be cancer free now?
Posts.Title: Am I Cured?

Posts.Content: Ok it's been 7 months since surgery and my PSA is still 0 so am I considered to be cancer free now?
Posts.Title: Am I Cured?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH Hi Puzzled, I moved your post from the "signature" sticky thread to it's very own thread so you get more attention. However, it would be helpful for you to post your stats into a signature so we can see what type of case you are/were dealing with. If your PSA is at 0 seven months after surgery, you have every reason to consider yourself cancer free. A lot of it depends on how aggressive your cancer was, what the post-op path report shows, etc. Once again, it will be very helpful to have your stats so we can offer better comments. In the meantime, indeed the value of ZERO is exactly what a man wants to see after prostate cancer surgery! Oh, my pre surgery PSA was about 18 - it had been climbing for several years but never doubled in 1 yr. 1st biopsy 3 yrs. ago was negative, my 2nd biopsy last April had 1 of 10 with a gleason score of a 6. I had Davinci RP last June at U of Mn. My pathology showed a positive margin gleason 7 but no positives in the seminal vesicles or lymph nodes and no extraprostatic extrusion. PSA tests since then have all been <0.01 with frequency of these at 3 months. Wife has me drinking lemon juice and pomagranet juice daily.
Posts.Title: Am I Cured?

Posts.Title: Am I Cured?

Posts.Content: Hi, I am recovering from surgery on June 26. Have had 3 undetectable PSA tests since surgery. However my surgeon and now the RO suggest IMRT and HT. Pathology says Gleason 8 and positive 0.4 cm margin at right base. Urologist says to wait a year so I am fully healed before thinking about radiation. Wondering what to do?
Posts.Title: After davinci RP for prostate cancer

Posts.Content: Ok here is more info from my pathology report: prostatic carcinoma, acinar type, Gleason 8 dominant focus 3.5 x 3.0 cm apex to base right, and Gleason 6 smaller focus 1.2 x 1.0 cm, left posterior. Tumor was 15 %;of gland. Stage pT2, organ confined. Pre surgery PSA was 19. No extra prostatic extension, no seminal vesicle, no lymphovascular, perineural is identified, prostate size is 5 x 4.3 x 3.5cm and 49.5 grams. Tumor size was 35 mm. Have had 3 PSA tests since surgery and all have been less than 0.01. I am 59 years old
